data.title: Death of David L. Robbins
data.meta_description: David L. Robbins of Gillespie, IL died Monday, October 10, 2011 at 5:50 pm at his residence. David was born December 6, 1959, in Litchfield, IL and was 51
data.text:
David L. Robbins of Gillespie, IL died Monday, October 10, 2011 at 5:50 pm at his residence. David was born December 6, 1959, in Litchfield, IL and was 51 years old at the time of his death. He was the son of Clark “Glenn” Robbins & Helen (Feyen) Robbins Arnold and was married to to Jenny R. (Holmes) Robbins. They were joined in marriage on February 9, 2001, Carlinville, IL. He was a driver for Waste Management Sanitation Services.

David is survived by spouse: Jenny Robbins of Gillespie, IL, daughter: Jessica Robbins of Gillespie, IL, 2 Step Children: Regina Holmes of Gillespie, IL, Aaron Anglin of Gillespie, IL, brothers: Glenn Robbins of Litchfield, IL, Robert Robbins of Springfield, IL, James Robbins of Jacksonville, IL, Harvey Robbins of San Bernardino, CA, Charles Robbins of Benld, IL, Oscar Robbins of Gillespie, IL, Leonard Robbins of Gillespie, IL, Terry Robbins of Gillespie, IL, Jerry Robbins of Gillespie, IL, Ronald Robbins of Wilsonville, IL, sisters: Ruth Ann Caldieraro of Staunton, IL, Jodie Arnold of Wilsonville, IL, grandchild: Nevaeh Morgan, Several nieces and nephews.

David was preceded in death by his parents and brothers: Richard Earl Robbins and Larry Dean Robbins.

Friends may call on Saturday, October 15, 2011 at Kravanya Funeral Home, Gillespie, IL from noon until 2:00 pm.

The funeral will take place on Saturday, October 15, 2011 at 2:00 PM at Kravanya Funeral Home, Gillespie, IL. The service will be ministered by Rev. Lawrence Price. Following the funeral services, his remains will be cremated and his cremains will be interred at Gillespie City Cemetery, Gillespie, IL.

Anyone wishing to send an online condolence may do so at www.kravanyafuneral.com

Kravanya Funeral Home is in charge of the arrangements.

Violet M. Ziglar, 97 of Staunton, passed away at 3:05 PM on Monday, August 19, 2024, at Community Hospital of Staunton. She was born on October 22, 1926, in Staunton, the daughter of the late Joseph and Ricca (Odorizzi) Fortuna.

She married Edward J. Ziglar on June 28, 1947, he passed away on January 15, 1999. Vi was primarily a homemaker but worked for a time as a clerk at Hefer’s Grocery Store in Staunton. She was also a member of St. Michael Catholic Church of Staunton.

She was a vibrant presence at the Staunton Country Club where her love for golf and swimming was only surpassed by the friendships she formed. Word has it she achieved the elusive hole-in-one, but verifying this is challenging as many of her friends have already passed through the gates of Heaven. Her smile was contagious and she brought energy and joy to everyone around her. In her younger years, she was passionate about quilting and creating beautiful ceramics, leaving behind a legacy of both art, and warmth.

Her grandchildren were her pride and joy and she showered them with boundless love, cooking, and wisdom. The memories she created with them will be cherished forever; a treasure trove of worth and happiness that will continue to inspire them throughout their lives.

Though she is no longer with us, the stories, lessons, and love remain. She was an amazing person and fought hard until God called her to His glorious home.

Violet is survived by her three children, E. Steven (Bev Hartman) Ziglar, Larry (Virginia) Ziglar, and Susan DeLaurent; four grandchildren, Tracy Morrison, Nicole (Todd) Bailey, Tim (Charlie) Sievers, and Kati (Greg) Harkins; eight great-grandchildren; and several nieces and nephews.

Besides her husband and parents, she was preceded in death by her brother, Dominic (Floriene) Fortuna, and her sister, Delores (Leroy) Hart.

Private services will be held at a later date. Memorials are suggested to the Staunton Country Club or to any Staunton charity. Williamson Funeral Home is in charge of arrangements.

Diana (Di) Bond Kilduff, 67 of Maryland Heights, MO, died on Saturday, August 3, 2024. Di was born on March 23, 1957, in Staunton to James and Sandra (Perrone) Bond.

She graduated from Staunton High School in 1975 before beginning a career in retail that spanned over 40 years. She most recently worked for Famous Footwear before retiring in October 2023.

Di was married to Randy Kilduff on June 6, 2009. Di never had children but found joy in being an aunt, stepmother, and step-grandmother. She also loved her animals as if they were her children. She was an avid St. Louis Cardinals fan and had a longstanding passion for jam bands, especially the Grateful Dead.

She was known locally throughout the 1980s and 90s for cohosting the infamous Staunton Farm Party showcasing Jake’s Leg and other local bands. Di was a free spirit. She went where the music took her and she danced as if each song might be her last.

She was preceded in death by her father, James Bond, and her step-son, Jarred.

She is survived by her loving husband, Randy Kilduff; mother, Sandra Bond; brother, John (Stacy) Bond; stepson, Adam Kilduff; as well as nieces, nephews, and step-grandchildren.

There are no services. Donations in her honor are suggested to the Rex Foundation, rexfoundation.org. Kriegshauser Mortuary-West Chapel is in charge of arrangements.

Fare you well, fare you well

I love you more than words can tell

Listen to the river sing sweet songs

To rock my soul

–The Grateful Dead (1970)
